fields.description:
Well most typical use case

SD agent creates an issue

SD agent assign himself as an "Agent" 

SD agent choose SAP administrator named for example Bob :) from the list and assign him as a "Resolver"  

 

we are still on the same issue

 

SD agent has own permissions to use transition to go through whole workflow or only for defined steps (defined by admin)

 

Resolver Bob has  his own permission to see running SLA, all details, add comments, updates, but he has also possibility to use transition for changing status in the workflow. This could be restricted by mandatory approval from Service Desk agent, but he has to have rights for transition from Created to In progress, In progress to pending (waiting for customer) and from In progress or waiting for* to Resolved.

 

Each transition done by Bob can be set as "have to be approved by assigned Agent, so Atlassian will still have almost the same licensing policy restricting to non agents to be fully operative in SD issues/projects.
fields.summary: JSD One issue rule them all  (way how to use only 1 issue for agent and developer with almost same license policy)

fields.description:
If I set the JSD Organizations field through the IssueService (IssueInputParameters) I can set an _int_ value, and have the related Organization set on the issue.

If I set multiple values, _int[]_, JSD fails to process this, its only 'expecting' a single integer value. It seems a doddle to expand this to detect an incoming int[] array and do multiple organisation lookups.

Currently the Cloud API for JSD allows setting multiple Organizations.  Because this can't be done through the standard IssueService, could be a bug.

Yes I'm sure if issues are created through JSD APi's directly, this may be achievable, we aren't, hence issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JIRA Service Desk comes with built-in reports for "Article usage" and "Article effectiveness". However, the metrics "Article views" and "Problems solved by articles" are only shown at an aggregate level.  There is no indication of which articles were viewed, or which articles helped solve a problem. 
h3. Suggested Solution

As an agent, I would like to know:
 * How many times each article was viewed within the customer portal
 * For each article, actual responses to "Did this article help?"  This would include number of "Yes" responses, number of "No" responses, and number of times the question was not answered. 
 * Who Sent Articles/Article Usage to Resolve Issues. The report only shows who has created the article. 

For example, this could be shown in a summary table with a row for each article, and a column for each metric.  To simplify the display, the data could be shown for one time period at a time.
fields.summary: Add details to Article usage and Article effectiveness reports

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom fields provided by add-ons can be added to the customer portal. When these add-ons are disabled and the customer portal or request type configuration page (/servicedesk/admin/<pkey>/request-types/request-type/\{id\}) is visited, these custom fields will be removed from the configuration. Re-enabling the add-on will *not* bring them back. Users will have to manually add and re-configure the custom field to get it to work.

This also happens for custom fields provided by default (eg. URL, Number, etc). Steps to reproduce below uses the default custom fields to reproduce

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a custom field of type _Number Field_ and add the field to the appropriate Service Desk screen
# Configure one of the request type for the Service Desk (/servicedesk/admin/<pkey>/request-types/group) and add the custom field to the request type
# Verify that this field is visible when visiting the Customer Portal
# Navigate to the *Manage add-ons* page, filter for _All add-ons_ and expand _Custom Field Types & Searchers_. Load all modules and *disable the _Number Field_ module* (Because we used _Number Field_ in step 2)
#* This simulates a disabled add-on when a custom field from an add-on is used instead
# Refresh the customer portal page where this field is visible in step #4
#* Either that, or refresh the request type configuration page where you added this custom field (eg. /servicedesk/admin/<pkey>/request-types/request-type/\{id})
# Repeat step 5 but this time enable the _Number Field_ module instead
# Refresh the page in step 7 again

h3. Expected Results
# Once the module is enabled, the field will re-appear in the customer portal and the configuration page when they are refreshed

h3. Actual Results
# The field doesn't re-appear and users will have to manually add the field again
# When checking the {{AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD}} table in the database, we can see that the relevant row is removed from the database after step 6 when the customer portal or configuration page is refreshed/loaded

h3. Notes
* If these pages aren't loaded/refreshed when the module/add-ons is disabled, the custom field configuration will remain
* This is raised as a Suggestion because it is intended behaviour. This feature is meant to automatically remove obsolete fields from the customer portal.
fields.summary: Custom field configuration for a request type will be lost when add-on / module is disabled

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The new SLA rendering feature only shows a maximum of 2 units of time in the SLA goal for readability. For example, a goal of _1w 6d 24h_ is showing as _1w 6d_, which gives Agents a wrong impression of the SLA goal. 

h3. Suggestion
- Show the exact goal or up to 3 units of time
- To render it in 24 Hour format rather than referring to the Working Hours. E.g. Taking the result of the Time from a REST Call below, it would show as "2d 1h" even though the working hours is not 24 hours per day:
{code}"remainingTime": {"friendly": "-49h 37m","millis": -178653955}{code}

h3. Why is this important
Showing only 2 units of time might not help Agents to have a clear picture of how much time they have. 'Due in' _1w 6d_ is very much different than 'due in' _1w 6d 24h_, instead of having to always hover over the remaining time to figure out when is the SLA due date and time, the readability and the accuracy of the goal display should be reliable. While for the 24 Hour format, it would be more friendly for the agents rather than have the need to check the working hours from the calendar which at the moment could be rendered like "1d 25h" wherein a day there should be only 24 hours.
fields.summary: Improving JIRA SLA Rendering

fields.description:
h5. Problem
According to Ehcache documentation http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/2.7/configuration/data-life.html#30343 elements can stay in the cache after expiration and actually expired element is evicted only when it is accessed or resource constraints are reached. As service desk doesn't set any size constraint for the cache, expired elements are not evicted during reindex, each element accessed only once.

For larger instances this can result in a massive amount of memory being consumed, causing indexing speeds to be slowed/impacted and maybe even fail.

This affects DC only. In Server environment different type of cache is used which behaves differently in this case.

h5. Workaround

On each node find atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/ehcache.xml file and add size limit for cache named "com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.customfield.SLACFType.slaValueCache", i.e.:
{code}
<cache name="com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.customfield.SLACFType.slaValueCache" maxBytesLocalHeap="500m"/>
{code} 
Restart node after updating ehcache.xml to changes to have effect.

h5. Fix

Fix sets default size limit for SLAValue global cache to 2 million elements and adds *system property* "servicedesk.slavalue.global.cache.size.limit" which can be used to change that limit.
Zero or negative value of this system property means unlimited cache size.
fields.summary: Service Desk causes memory pressure during indexing in Data Center

fields.description:
h2. *Summary of Issue*

When a User has been previously renamed, if that user sends in an Email (with CC participants) to the Jira Service Desk handler, the Jira Service Desk Handler will create the ticket but not add the participants due to what appears like the Jira Toolkit *AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType* not obtaining the correctly mapped field in {{app_user}}.

h2. *How to reproduce*

# Install JIRA Service Desk
#* Create a new user on setup with email address {{admin@mydomain.com}}
# Through *Jira Administration* » *Add-ons* » *Find new add-ons*
#* Install *Jira Toolkit*
# Navigate to the *Issues* » *Custom Fields* page
#* Create a new *Advanced* » *Username of last updater or commenter* and add this to all the screens
# Setup Jira Service Desk Mail Handler with say _{{jira@mydomain.com}}_ as the listening email address
# Create a new user in Jira Administration » User Management: _{{support@mydomain.com}}_ with email address _{{support@mydomain.com}}_
#* Rename _{{support@mydomain.com}}_ and email address to _{{support\_leave@mydomain.com}}_. Make this account *inactive*.
#* After the above - *app_user*: {{support@mydomain.com}} mapped to {{support_leave@mydomain.com}}
# Create another new user _{{test@mydomain.com}}_ with email address _{{support@mydomain.com}}_
#* Rename _{{test@mydomain.com}}_ to _{{support@mydomain.com}}_
#* After the above - *app_user*: {{test@mydomain.com}} mapped to {{support@mydomain.com}}
# Navigate to *Jira Administration* » *System* » *Logging and profiling*
#* Enable Incoming Mail debugging (you may need to add a dummy Incoming POP mail Server to access this debug)
#* Set *{{com.atlassian}}* to *DEBUG*
# Send email from *{{support@mydomain.com}}* to {{jira@mydomain.com}} CC {{admin@mydomain.com}}. CC must be included to trigger the exception.

Running a {{tail -f}} on {{atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log}} will result in this stack trace:

{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: User 'test@mydomain.com' was not found in the system.
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.updateIssue(ImmutableCustomField.java:1042) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.updateIssueFromFieldsWithoutScreenCheck(DefaultIssueService.java:850) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.updateIssueFromFields(DefaultIssueService.java:803) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.validateAndUpdateIssueFromFields(DefaultIssueService.java:684) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.validateUpdate(DefaultIssueService.java:286) [classes/:?]
...
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.customfields.participants.ParticipantsCustomFieldManagerImpl.updateUserParticipants(ParticipantsCustomFieldManagerImpl.java:110) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.reqparticipants.field.RequestParticipantsInternalManagerImpl.updateParticipantsField(RequestParticipantsInternalManagerImpl.java:110) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.reqparticipants.field.RequestParticipantsInternalManagerImpl.lambda$addParticipants$5(RequestParticipantsInternalManagerImpl.java:71) [?:?]
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: User 'test@mydomain.com' was not found in the system.
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.converters.UserConverterImpl.getUser(UserConverterImpl.java:50) [classes/:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26) [atlassian-plugins-core-4.1.0.jar:?]
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy28.getUser(Unknown Source) [?:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:136) [?:?]
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy28.getUser(Unknown Source) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.toolkit.customfield.AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType.java:55) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CalculatedCFType.getValueFromCustomFieldParams(CalculatedCFType.java:65) [jira-api-7.2.7.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.updateIssue(ImmutableCustomField.java:1038) [classes/:?]
	... 121 more
{code}

h2. *Expected Result*

As both the sender and participant are valid users, the participants should have been added to the newly created ticket.

h2. *Actual Result*

The above stack trace is thrown, the ticket is then created with no participants added.

h2. *Cause*

The root cause appears to be caused by [Jira Toolkit Pligin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.toolkit/server/overview] and specifically the *Username of last updater or commenter* (AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType) Custom Field type not handling the scenario when a user has been renamed.

h2. *Resolution*

Update the [Jira Toolkit add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.toolkit/server/overview] to at least Version 0.35.14 which fixes this bug.
fields.summary: Jira Toolkit AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType does not handle renamed usernames

fields.description:
h3. Summary.
If JIRA Service Desk is using another JIRA as a User Server and the user is only set as "Only" JIRA Administrator in Global Permission, they won't be able to login with a message:
bq. You do not have a permission to log in. If you think this is incorrect, please contact your JIRA administrators.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Install JIRA Service Desk instance and Create a Service Desk Project.
# Install another instance of JIRA Software and configure the "User Server" function.
#- [Allowing connections to JIRA for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/allowing-connections-to-jira-for-user-management-802592340.html]
# Integrate JIRA Service Desk with JIRA Software following the article above.
# In JIRA Software instance, create a dummy user that has "only jira-administrator" group.
# In JIRA Service Desk, sync JIRA Software directory and set the following:
#- Global Permission for JIRA System Admin and JIRA Admin is set to 'jira-administrator' (by default)
#- Remove 'jira-administrator' from any Application Access.
# Access JIRA Service Desk Project Settings and set the Customer Permission to be available for anyone (3rd option)
# Open a new browser and access the portal.
# Login as a user with JIRA Software with JIRA Admin permission only.

h3. Expected Result:
* The portal is open to the public where the portal will be available for anyone hence, login will be successful.

h3. Actual Result:
This error will come up and the user won't be able to log in:
bq. You do not have a permission to log in. If you think this is incorrect, please contact your JIRA administrators.

h3. Notes:
# If you include the user to another group and the group is set to the project "Service Desk Customer" Role, the user will be able to log in but no portal will be available for the user.
# This could be only replicated once, removing the user from the group and adding it again later would not be able to replicate the issue again.
# Similar issue can happen when the restricting the Portal only from the Customer List (Option 1)

h3. Workaround:
* Remove the user from the JIRA Admin and JIRA System Admin group or remove the group from that permission.
fields.summary: JIRA Admin user unable to login to Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-10282].
{panel}

h3. Summary
When no issues are opened during a reported time period, it is more useful to management(who is reading the report) to see that 100% of a goal was met rather than 0%.  With the current design of the '% Met' report options, it is impossible to tell whether a bunch of tickets have been raised and breached, or no tickets have been raised at all.

h3. Environment
Service Desk 3.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the default SLA goal configuration in a pristine environment
# Create a new test issue at the "Highest" severity
# Immediately transition the issue to closed
# Create a new custom report that displays 'Time to resolution - % Met'
# Set the report to 'Past 48 hours'
# Notice the spike from 0% to 100% in the last hour
# Wait an hour without opening any other issues
# Notice the last hour moves back to 0%

The same behavior happens when 'Time to first response - % Met' is selected.  

h3. Expected Results
During periods where 'No issues' are found, the goal of responding to or resolving zero tickets has essentially been achieved.  This should be reflected as 100% met.    

h3. Actual Results
Periods where 'No issues' are found reflect as 0% met.  This information doesn't reflect whether issues are not being responded to or if no issues came in at all.

h3.Workaround
While it is possible to us the 'Time to first response - Breached' and 'Time to resolution - Breached' options to get similar information from the opposite direction, the '% met' reports contain totals for all of the incoming tickets.  This is potentially more useful because you might be able to extrapolate why issues are breaching(e.g., higher volume).
fields.summary: SLA report should reflect "100% met" when no requests are opened during the reported time period

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 9 June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this suggestion.

We have identified that this is a duplicate of _"Auto-refresh and/or warn user if the ticket has changed"_ JSDSERVER-433 . We are actively reviewing this suggestion and will continue to track interest on the other ticket. Please watch JSDSERVER-433 for future updates.

Kind regards,

Alex

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center 
{panel}

 

For example, automation rules inspects a custom field on transition to status A. If the field has content, the issue is changes to B status. If the field is empty the status changes to C status.

Currently when users transition issues to status A they will initially see their issue in status A. Upon refresh the issue's status is correctly displayed as either B or C.

This request is for a mechanism that will auto-refresh an issue so that users will see the issue status after an automation rule takes effect

Workaround: Use JavaScript, looking for form elements that are unique to this condition, and refresh the page when true.

Notes: Also happen for adding comment from agent side.
fields.summary: Auto-refresh issue transitioned from Service Desk automation rule

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to [Setting up queues for your team|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver038/setting-up-queues-for-your-team-935909293.html?_ga=2.153005245.586019596.1508137504-1729042927.1506935118], the administrator has the ability to manage the queues, which includes reordering them.

However, many agents would like to be able to reorder queues according to their personal preference.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow agents to reorder their own queues. Perhaps the administrator can at least set a default order, and then the agents can change their personal order, should they choose.

Note: I am *not* referring to sorting the contents inside the queues, but the actual order they appear on the sidebar.
fields.summary: Allow Agents to Reorder Queues

fields.description:
As an Agent, I want the ability to determine which queues I see in the Queue list so that I can focus only on those queues of concern to me.

As an Agent, I only need to see queues that directly affect my work. I don't need to see how many tickets are assigned to other groups or have issues that I don't need to handle. Currently, I need to see the entire list of queues that my admin has created. This makes it hard to glance at the queues of special importance to me.

h3. Summary:
Even though a request type is already being hidden in a project, it is still searchable through the Help Center.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk Project.
# Navigate to the Project Administration Page.
# Select "Request Types" and create a New Group.
# In that New Group, create a new Request Type.
# Navigate to the Service Desk Help Center and search the Request Type, it will be showing.
# Back to the Project Administration page and delete the Group.
# Automatically, the request type will be moved to "Hidden from portal" group.
# Do another search of the request type on the Help Center.

h3. Expected Result:
* The request type would not be showing as a search result.

h3. Actual Result:

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Today, customers can raise a request as a Reporter and appoint themselves as the Approver as well. In some cases, this should be prohibited but it's not possible in Jira out-of-the-box.

h3. Suggestion
To have an option/any validation check to allow or reject request creation if the Reporter or the Creator = Approver of the same request

h3. Why is it important
In many business use cases, a user shouldn't be able to approve his/her own request. For example, expenses claim approvals that should only be approved by the authorized managers in the company. It should be able to prevent Reporters from being able to approve their own requests.
fields.summary: Option to exclude the Reporter and the Creator from the list of the Approvers

h3. *Environment*
* JIRA Version 7.5.0
* JIRA Service Desk 3.8.1

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a service desk issue type *service request*
# Click on *resolve this issue* to resolve the issue as shown below:

h3. *Expected Results*
No message is shown or a correct message such as this issue will be resolved should be displayed.

h3. *Actual Results*
Just by clicking the transition even without completing it a message stating *request resolved* is shown as shown in the image below:

It is just a UI bug which shows an incorrect message and does not have any effect on how the workflow perform.

Currently no known workaround for this bug

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The *Add approval.* and *Configure* options could be missing from the workflow, not because the workflow is inactive or associated with non-Service Desk projects.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Go to {{Administration > Issues > Workflows}}.
# Edit generic workflow for Change Management.
# On the diagram mode of the workflow, click on the *Peer review / change manager approval* status.

h3. Expected result
The settings appear on the right with the *Add approval.* and *Configure* options visible.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result
The *Add approval.* and *Configure* options are missing until you click on other transitions or statuses and click on the approval status again.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Click on other transitions or statuses and click on the *Peer review / change manager approval* status again.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Current Behavior:*

JIRA can be connected to Crowd and customers may appear in the Crowd directory. Crowd allows the admin to select from the following:
* Allow all to authenticate
* Allow only members of configured groups to authenticate

Regardless of the selection all users in the directory will appear in JIRA's list of users. When JSD is set to allow anyone with an account these users will also appear in the customer list on JSD projects. 

Can cause problems for JSD admins when this is set to allow only configured groups. 
* Users who appear in the customer lists are believed to be able to log into the customer portal. 
* In reality these users are not able to log in because they do not have permission to authenticate in Crowd.
* JSD Admin does not expect that these users need to be added to any group. Does not see any indication that the users are unable to log in. 

*Suggested Change*
Add indicator to customer list that will show if a user is not able to authenticate. 
* Note this is blocked by CWD-1263
fields.summary: Indicate in JSD when customer is in Crowd and has no permission to authenticate

h3. Problem definition

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

Depending on how an _Internal Comment_ is made on a Jira ticket:
 # On the comment box on the _main Issue Page_; or
 # On the comment box on a _Transition screen_

Jira records the sd.public.comment 'internal' entity property as a Boolean and String respectively.
h4. How to reproduce
 # Install Jira Service Desk 3.8.1
 # Create a new *Basic Service Desk* Project with no data (with say _Project key SDP_)
 # Create a new ticket of Issue Type *Task* (which will be SDP-1)
 # Enter a Internal Comment with text {{INTERNAL-COMMENT-COMMENTBOX}}
 # Click *Start Progress* and add Internal Comment with text {{INTERNAL-COMMENT-TRANSITION}} on the transition screen

Now, run the following query on the Jira Database:
{code:java}
select jiraissue.id as "jiraissueid", project.pkey, jiraissue.issuenum, jiraaction.actionbody, entity_property.*
FROM project, jiraissue, jiraaction left join entity_property on jiraaction.id = entity_property.entity_id
where jiraissue.project = project.id 
and project.pkey = 'SDP'
and jiraissue.issuenum in (1)
and jiraissue.id = jiraaction.issueid
and entity_property.entity_name = 'CommentProperty'
and entity_property.property_key = 'sd.public.comment'
order by jiraissue.issuenum desc
{code}
 

SQL Results will be something like:
||jiraissueid||pkey||issuenum||actionbody||id||entity_name||entity_id||property_key||created||updated||json_value||
|10100|SDP|1|INTERNAL-COMMENT-TRANSITION|10105|CommentProperty|10102|sd.public.comment|2017-10-05 17:24:00|2017-10-05 17:24:00|\{"internal":"true"}|
|10100|SDP|1|INTERNAL-COMMENT-COMMENTBOX|10107|CommentProperty|10103|sd.public.comment|2017-10-05 17:24:09|2017-10-05 17:24:09|\{"internal":true}|

Note the differences in the JSON string.

# {{"true"}} denotes a String
# {{true}} denotes a Boolean
 
These results consequently flow out to the REST end point API respectively as:

{code}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/comment/10105/properties/sd.public.comment

{"key":"sd.public.comment","value":{"internal":"true"}}
{code}
 
{code}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/comment/10107/properties/sd.public.comment

{"key":"sd.public.comment","value":{"internal":true}}
{code}

h4. Expected Result

Jira should store the value of this property with the same consistent type regardless how the internal comment was added.

This can lead to type cast exceptions in add-ons that depend on reading this value.
fields.summary: Comment internal entity property is stored with different types depending on operation

fields.description:
Hi there,

JSD API offers some plugin points where app can mount panels in the customer portal: [https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-applications/jira-service-desk/jira-service-desk-ui-plugin-points-customer-portal1|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-applications/jira-service-desk/jira-service-desk-ui-plugin-points-customer-portal]

One of our add-on allows user to add data to an issue though a dedicated panel (something else than custom fields).

It works with Jira Core & Jira Software (we mount panels in the issue view) but the mounting points currently available on JSD are not enough to create an acceptable user experience.

This mounting point is almost what we want:
[!https://uploads-discourse-atl-community-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/optimized/3X/a/a/aa3ad7ac661e938763d9c7acedf2579536aa0c93_1_690x338.png|width=690,height=338!|https://uploads-discourse-atl-community-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/original/3X/a/a/aa3ad7ac661e938763d9c7acedf2579536aa0c93.png]
 

In fact, we want the exact same thing but the panel should be *above* the create button.

Atlassian, it is in your plans to add more plugin points in JSD?
Is there a public issue we can vote on?

Cheers
Chritstophe - Valiantys Software

h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, when a ticket is assigned to an approver and the approver is out of office, there will be a delay in getting approval for the ticket or agent will need to manually change the approver to another available person.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Provide a feature in JIRA service desk whereby when an approver designate that they are out of office, and any tickets they are approvers on are automatically sent to another approver they designate. 

h3. *Why this is important*
* This will help to smoothen a business process that is using JIRA service desk approval feature. 
* The feature will reduce in wait time to get an approval for any raised ticket when the original approver is away.
* Reduce Manual work of assigning the ticket to another approver.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Emails with MIME header that do not comply to the [RFC2046|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046] convention will be rejected by the Service Desk incoming mail handler.
* {{There was an error reading the body of email message.}} will be seen in the Processing log for the rejected email.
* Error below appears in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}
{code}
2017-08-28 09:17:06,643 Caesium-1-3 WARN admin@atlassian.com     [c.a.s.i.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailParser] Error processing email message
java.io.IOException: Unknown encoding: 7-bit
	at javax.mail.internet.MimePartDataSource.getInputStream(MimePartDataSource.java:115)
	at com.sun.mail.handlers.text_plain.getContent(text_plain.java:80)
	at javax.activation.DataSourceDataContentHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:795)
	at javax.activation.DataHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:542)
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getContent(MimeBodyPart.java:657)
...
{code}

h3. Suggestion
Better approach to handle emails with invalid header

h3. Notes
The cause of the issue is that the mail server is sending emails with an invalid encoding which cannot be processed by javamail. The workaround is to change the mail server settings to send *base64* or *binary* encoded emails to the Service Desk email channel.
fields.summary: Error processing incoming email - Unknown encoding: 7-bit

{noformat}
Once we uninstall SD, we are left with a few of these add-ons still in the folder
{noformat}
atlassian-chaperone-4.0.1-D20160710T234528.jar
atlassian-client-resource-1.2.5-D20150501T012542.jar

# Uninstall Service Desk application

Service Desk installs successfully

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The new SLA rendering feature includes the holiday in the display which is confusing. The expectation is that the goal will not be changed with an additional holiday on a weekday.

However, if there is a holiday defined in the calendar and if his holiday occurs *any day after the creation of an issue and before the SLA goal is reached*, an extra day will be added to the "within" and "remaining" time of the SLA panel.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Configure the SLA calendar to have working hours from 9am to 6pm, Monday to Friday.
 # Configure the Time to resolution SLA to have a goal of 30 hours.
 # Create a ticket at 10.30am Monday.
 # Take note of the goal and display of the Time to resolution SLA of the ticket.
 # Edit the SLA calendar and add Tuesday (the next day) as a holiday and save it.
 # Check the same ticket for the goal of the Time to resolution SLA.
 # Remove the holiday from the calendar and repeat the previous step.

h3. Expected result
 * The goal shouldn't change with Tuesday being a holiday, however, the due date & time should be one day later.
 ** *Before adding a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is 2d 12h. Due on Thursday 1.30pm.
 ** *After adding a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is still 2d 12h. Due on Friday 1.30pm.
 ** *After removing a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is still 2d 12h. Due on Thursday 1.30pm.

h3. Actual result
 * The goal and the due date & time both changed.
 ** *Before adding a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is 2d 12h. Due on Thursday 1.30pm.
 ** *After adding a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is *3d 12h*. Due on Friday 1.30pm.
 (i) with the goal being 3d 12h, it gives the wrong impression that there are 3 working days and 12 working hours remaining.
 ** *After removing a holiday*: The goal of the Time to resolution SLA is back to 2d 12h. Due on Thursday 1.30pm.

h3. Workaround

You may disable the [improved SLA rendering feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver0311/how-teams-see-slas-946628553.html] as per [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-revert-the-sla-rendering-improvement-changes-943970007.html] as a workaround to avoid causing any confusion to your Service Desk agents. Please note that disabling this feature will also change the unit of the SLAs displayed to your agents: they will no longer be displayed in Years, months, weeks or days unit, but only in hours and minutes.
fields.summary: SLA panel add an extra day to the "within" and "remaining" time if there is a holiday in the calendar

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

We have moved this ticket to a suggestion, as the mentioning feature on the Agent/Jira view does not currently take unlicensed-user/customer role into account.

We will explore adding support for mentioning on the Agent view to improve the options available to agents when mentioning their customers. In the meantime, we suggest using @mentions on the customer portal, which is available in [Jira Service Management Data Center version 4.18|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-18-x-release-notes-1072467369.html#JiraServiceManagement4.18.xreleasenotes-cpimprovements]. Mentioned users will be added as request participants, ensuring that these participants are mentioned without needing to have first made a comment on the request.

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can read more about our [approach to highly voted suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117], and [how we prioritise what to implement here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].

To learn more about our recent investments in Jira Service Management and Data Center, please check our [public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/data-center?product=jiraService&status=shipped] and our two dashboards containing [recently resolved issues|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94990], and [current work and future plans|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94991].

Please watch and vote on this ticket to keep up to date with current progress.

Kind regards,

Charlie Marriott
Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}
h3. Problem definition

Agents are not able to mention the request participants via {{@username}} as the participants will not show up in the list. Until they have added a comment, it's possible to mention the participants as the commenters.
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Add a customer as the request participant.
 # As an Agent, try to mention the request participant using {{@username}} in the Jira issue view of the request.
 # As the request participant, add a comment to the request.
 # As an Agent, try to mention the request participant again using {{@username}} in the Jira issue view of the request.

h3. Expected result

It's possible to mention the request participant even he/she hasn't added any comments yet.
h3. Actual result

It's not possible to mention the request participant if he/she hasn't added any comments yet.
h3. Workaround

As of [Jira Service Management Data Center version 4.18|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-18-x-release-notes-1072467369.html#JiraServiceManagement4.18.xreleasenotes-cpimprovements] you can use @mentions on the customer portal. Mentioned users will be added as request participants, ensuring that these participants can be mentioned on the portal without them needing to have first made a comment on the request.
fields.summary: Participants cannot be mentioned until they have added a comment

fields.description:
When creating an approval flow, you often need to allow the customer to choose an approver from a list.  This is where the User Picker field comes in.  As the customer starts to type an approver's name in the field, the field autofills potential approvers' names.

However, according to the JIRA Service Desk documentation, for the autofill to work, you have to allow customers to share their requests:
{quote}{{_"Before you begin, make sure your *Customer permissions > Who can customers share request with?* setting is on *Any customer or organization, by searching in this project*. This ensures that customers can search for approvers."_}}
{quote}
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-approvals-816880004.html]

In some environments, this is fine, but in ours, we really don't want customers sharing requests, since the requests have the potential of containing (somewhat) sensitive data.  Nonetheless, we would still like the User Picker field to still autofill.

Could we get request-sharing permissions and User Picker autofill permissions separated so that they do not affect one another?
fields.summary: Allow autofill in "User Picker" field without allowing request sharing

When creating a new Service Desk project, the project role *Administrators* is only populated with the user that created the project. Change the template for Service Desk projects so that it matches the other project types, causing the *jira-administrators* group to be placed in the *Administrators* upon project creation.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The documentation [Managing service desk notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver036/managing-service-desk-notifications-921471702.html] needs some clarification about the situation where an Agent is assigned to a request shared with an organization, while being part of the organization.

In the documentation, it says:
{quote}
Agents don't receive notifications of their own changes when they act as a customer on issues with a set request type. Agents acting as a reporter, participant or approver on these issues are always treated as a customer, regardless of the settings in their project's JIRA notification scheme.
{quote}

In this paragraph, only the roles reporter, participant and approver are mentioned, but there is no mention of the case where the agent is part of an organization.

A customer faced the situation where the agent was part of an organization, and the documentation was not clear enough about how the notifications should be sent to the agent.

In this situation, we should say that the Agent:
- won't receive any email notification from the project's JIRA notification scheme (even if this Agent is the assignee of the ticket)
- will only receive the customer notification saying "XXXX shared this with your organization. View the request and select Get notifications to follow along."

I was able to reproduce this behavior by following these steps:
- I created a service desk project
- I created the organization "Organization 1" that contains a customer and an agent
- I filed a new request from the portal by using the customer account , and shared it with Organization 1 
- The agent received a customer notification saying that a ticket was shared with my organization 
- I used an admin user in JIRA to assign the ticket to the agent 
- I added a comment to the ticket from the customer account
- The agent didn't receive any notification


h3. Why this is important

The notification system in Service Desk is pretty complex, and there are lots of different scenarios that impact the way notifications are sent to customers or agents.
For this reason, our documentation should be as complete as possible.

h3. Workaround

Improve the documentation to include the scenario where the Agent:
- is part of an organization shared in a request
- and is the assignee of the ticket
fields.summary: Improve documentation about "Managing service desk notifications"

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When an agent is only a customer in a JIRA Service Desk project, if he comments and there is an automation rule that should be triggered if the user is not an agent, JIRA would fail to trigger the automation for the licensed user rather than respect the Project Permission or Project Roles.

h5. Steps to Reproduce.

# Create a JIRA user and grant them a service desk license.
# Create a project and ensure the user mentioned above is only a customer.
#* Must not be in any role that would grant him agent privileges.
# Make sure the user is not in any group or roles that has the project permission Service Desk agent.
# Create an automation rule to transition an issue to a different status if the user is not an agent.
||WHEN||IF||THEN||
|Comment Added|customer request type ="Get IT Help" and User Type = Not an Agent|Transition issue to new status|
# Add a comment that fulfills the above condition in the automation with a user who is just a customer and do the same with the Agent who is just a customer in the project.
 
h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would trigger the automation as specified in the rules set.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would fail the automation rule because it sees the use as an agent when you check the Automation rule log.
fields.summary: Licensed Users seen as Agents in projects they are not listed as agents.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When Service Desk is not enabled for some reason, it will show as {{Service Desk is licensed but not installed}} in the Versions and licenses page and an _Install_ button will be available. If an admin attempts to re-enable Service Desk by clicking on the _Install_ button, it will remove the Service Desk plugin from the instance.
* Message below can be seen in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}
{code}
2017-08-25 14:40:48,149 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1 INFO admin 880x276x2 1djbdyf 192.168.12.134,192.168.99.107 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Updating plugin 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.application' from version '3.6.4' to version '3.6.4'
2017-08-25 14:40:48,173 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1 INFO admin 880x276x2 1djbdyf 192.168.12.134,192.168.99.107 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Removed plugin 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.application'
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# When Jira Service Desk application appears as {{Service Desk is licensed but not installed}} in the Versions and licenses page (most likely due to disabled plugins), click on the _Install_ button to reinstall the application or upload the application {{.obr}} file manually.

h3. Expected result
Jira Service Desk will be installed and the message {{Service Desk is licensed but not installed}} will disappear.

h3. Actual result
Jira Service Desk remains licensed but not installed. An error occurred for the attempt of reinstallation.

h3. Workaround
# Shut down Jira.
# Go to {{$JIRA_Home/plugins/installed-plugins}}, remove all files with *servicedesk* in its name.
# Start Jira.
# Reinstall Service Desk.
fields.summary: Re-installing Service Desk application remove the Service Desk plugin

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The multilingual service desk is not implemented in Server, thus it's expected to see fields and some settings in English regardless of the customer's profile language. Nevertheless, for some languages like Japanese and German, all general settings are correctly translated. However, if a user uses Chinese as the profile language, everything remains in English.

This also affects Service Desk Screens in JIRA Administration, such as the "JIRA Service Desk Configuration" screen
h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
 # Change the JIRA default language to Chinese.
 # Log in to the portal and verify the profile language as Chinese.
 # Go to the main portal page and observe the display language.
 # Change the language to Japanese.
 # Go to the main portal page and observe the display language.

h3. Expected result

Many settings/buttons/links are displayed in the language same as the profile language, for example, the page below shows some options in Japanese when using Japanese.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result

The profile page is displayed in English.
fields.summary: General settings in the Customer Portal is not translated to Chinese

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no documentation explaining how to use and where to find the "Language support" functionality for Service Desk and for Server only.

There is currently some [documentation for Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/translating-your-customer-portal-and-supporting-multiple-languages-886180551.html/], but:
- the location of the "Language support" is different on Server
- the behavior of the "Language support" functionality is different on both platforms (for example, on server, it is only possible to add language support for customer notifications)

Hence the documentation for Cloud doesn't apply and might confuse the Service Desk users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a page for the "Language Support" functionality for Server.
fields.summary: Documentation missing for the "Language Support" functionality of Service Desk for Server (although available for Cloud)
